description: Students learn a widely-used  style of programming based on first order predicate logic.  Topics
include declarative programming, Horn clauses, declarative and procedural semantics of logic
programs, clauses as relations, goals, backtracking, and resolution.  Programming projects and
exercises use Prolog, the most significant logic programming language.  Additional topics include
the relationship of Prolog to logic and applications to artificial intelligence.  Prerequisites:
Computer Science 251 or permission of instructor. Next offered in spring 2011 and spring 2013.
